medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 41-year-old baker, developed rhinoconjunctivitis and asthma a few months after using a spraying device for egg glazing. He initially remained asymptomatic during weekends and holidays, but after 9 months of mixing wheat flour, symptoms recurred. He had no symptoms on ingestion of egg or wheat flour.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past history of sensitization to inhalative allergens including egg white, wheat flour, and lysozyme, as confirmed by skin prick tests.
medical_history.social_history: The patient worked in a bakery for 25 years and had seven birds and a cat at home.
